sentences.english: Health facilities have been set up to diagnose and treat malaria.
sentences.chinese: 建立了衛生設施以診斷和治療瘧疾。

sentences.english: Rosetting contributes to severe malaria by blocking the flow of blood through small blood vessels.
sentences.chinese: 通過阻擋血流通過小血管，花結對重症瘧疾也有貢獻。

sentences.english: Maalin was admitted to the hospital on October 25 with a presumptive diagnosis of malaria.
sentences.chinese: 馬阿林在10月25日初步診斷爲瘧疾住院。

sentences.english: Malaria is spread by  mosquito bites.
sentences.chinese: 瘧疾經由蚊子叮咬傳播。

sentences.english: This opportunity is unprecedented in the history of malaria control.
sentences.chinese: 這一機會在瘧疾控制的歷史中是前所未有的。

sentences.english: About a decade ago, observers of the malaria situation had one positive comment.
sentences.chinese: 大約十年前，瘧疾狀況的觀察者曾有一個積極的評論。

sentences.english: The campaign to eradicate malaria did not.
sentences.chinese: 而根除瘧疾運動則未做到這一點。

sentences.english: Objective To learn layperson perception of Wa ethnic toward malaria.
sentences.chinese: 目的瞭解佤族羣衆對瘧疾的認知情況。

sentences.english: In Africa, one child dies of the disease every 30 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 在非洲，每30秒就有一個孩子因爲瘧疾而夭折。

sentences.english: More than two million children are at risk of malaria and kala-azar in famine-stricken Africa.
sentences.chinese: 超過兩百萬兒童在饑荒的非洲瘧疾和黑熱病的風險。

sentences.english: The bait-and-kill strategy is a new one in malaria prevention efforts.
sentences.chinese: 誘殺蚊子是預防瘧疾的一種新招法。

sentences.english: Professor Tatem says a number of things have helped countries successfully fight malaria.
sentences.chinese: 塔特姆教授表示，許多情況有助於國家成功防治瘧疾。

sentences.english: In the United States, it will be marked as the country's first Malaria Awareness Day.
sentences.chinese: 美國將舉行該國第一個瘧疾宣傳日。

sentences.english: We hope other malaria-endemic countries will quickly follow suit.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望其它有瘧疾流行疫情的國家也儘快照做”。

sentences.english: They are the manifestations of half exterior and half interior seen in shaoyang disease or malaria.
sentences.chinese: 它是半表半里證的表現，見於少陽病和瘧疾。

definition: bacterial tracheitis (inflammation of the windpipe, often caused by Staphylococcus aureus)/henpecked (a pun on 妻子管得严 used in comic theater)
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion

pinyin: feng1 shi1 xing4 guan1 jie2 yan2

definition: injury such as contusion, sprain or fracture from falling, blow etc
